reviews.text: Due to issues setting up a trip to Panama City, I was forced to stay at this Marriott, when I typically prefer small boutique hotels. I thought that in exchange for the lack of charm, I would at least be able to take advantage of "big hotel" features, like lots of options for eating and drinking, and also to be able to enjoy the swimming pool. Not so. One of the problems in finding a decent hotel in Panama City seems to be the fact that most of the city is under construction. In addition to much renovation and building, the city is building a metro, which causes major disruption of traffic, dirt & noise. The Marriott was recommended as a hotel which would be quieter than many others, so I agreed to stay there. The rooms were clean & quiet; even the air handling system was quiet, which I greatly appreciated. Very good sleep quality: nice linens, good bed. Some furnishings were quite new, like the carpet and draperies. Other parts, like the desk, looked pretty old, and had scuffs touched-up. There was some mildew on the grout in the bathroom. All of the staff members that we encountered were very pleasant. Now for the things I didn't like. First of all, I was a tourist, and hoped to enjoy the pool during some of my free time. The pool was closed for safety reasons due to construction on the building next door. That seemed sensible, but I was disappointed. When I asked the concierge about the closure, she said that the hotel offered a free taxi to another hotel nearby to use that pool, but it seemed like too much effort. Secondly, food and drink were unduly difficult. We were not on the "club" floor, so our choices were the cafe, the lobby bar and the sports bar "Champions". The lobby bar was nice, but frequently closed. We went for a drink Friday evening around 6pm----closed! The lobby bar remained closed for virtually any time you might want a cocktail. Sundays are sometimes problematic for dining, so we planned to just eat in the cafe Sunday evening----closed! For both cocktails & dining, the only option was Champions, which, honestly, is hideous. Decor by 14 year-old boys----peanuts in football helmets, really?----head banger music, multiple tv screens of various sports, mostly junk food on the menu. This place is awful, but it was often the only choice. Marriott, please lose this hangover from the 1980's. Third, WiFi was not free, and there was a hefty charge to use the internet in the Business Center. Finally, as other reviewers have mentioned, the taxi issue is a problem, and the hotel should be more active in intervening. The taxis in Panama City are apparently on a "zone" fee basis, rather than on meters. This means that they can basically rape and pillage on price, and you don't have much bargaining power. My travel guide said that the price from the Marriott to Casco Viejo should be $3. The rate that I got was $8, and the bellman was of no use in getting a better price. We were able to walk to some restaurants, and felt pretty safe, although sidewalks are in very bad repair, and if you are not careful, you could break your neck. Overall, Panama City isn't a tourist-friendly place, and the city is not doing much to change this. The Marriott is fine if you have to work the entire time; otherwise consider another place.
reviews.title: ok for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice Marriott with above average service but no view and not in best area for tourists. Despite being only two blocks from the Bristol, probably the best hotel in the city, I found little I liked about the area in which the Marriott is located. As others have noted cabs from the hotel are a good deal more expensive that if you get one on the street which I had a problem with. That said the rooms are larger than what I consider average for Marriott and were it not for the location I would rate this an above average Marriott. The staff was certainly helpful and they all seemed to speak good English, not the norm in PC. I would recommend this to a tourist speaking no Spanish and staying a single day before going off the the mountains or coast but I have stayed in better places for less in PC.
reviews.title: Good service but otherwise an averaged Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should note that if I had paid the advance purchase weekend rate I would likely have rated the property higher but at $200 plus a day, and 35% more for every cab you take, it is not a bargain. If you like Marriott hotels you will probably like this one but there are other four star hotels in the city that have better locations and are a bit less expensive. Consider a luxury B&B if you don't need to be in the business center of town.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriot in Panama City on January 2012 as part of our trip and my husband High School was celebrating their 30 year reunion. The room was big, nice and clean and the overall hotel service was excellent. The food served during the reception was great and not to mention the helpful and friendly staff. The room included breakfast the next morning which was also great. The location is perfect, right on the heart of the city with many ammenities closed by.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, friendly service, good location.

reviews.text: We stayed at the panama marriott hotel for a weekend. The hotel is beautiful. Hotel concierge services were excellent, they consistently gave us good reccomendations and made sure we enjoyed out stay.
reviews.title: Service at the casino upstairs is terrible
It would rate a "5" if it were not for the exorbitant wifi and Internet charge
reviews.text: We wanted a place to relax after our 10 day trip all over Panama and this hotel was perfect.

The rooms were spacious, the bed was comfortable, it was very quiet, it was very clean, the staff spoke English, breakfast was included and was a delicious buffet, the concierge steered us to two great local restaurants, the elevators were fast and coordinated with no wait time, a nice sports bar for a quick lunch and it was a great location in a safe area either to walk to restaurants or take a short cab ride.
reviews.title: Good but generic big box experience

reviews.text: Other than the wifi ripoff, this place was perfect.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in an undesirable area

reviews.text: I stayed here 3 nights on business. This is a large clean and well run hotel but is let down by a lack of character. Further, the neighborhood in which it is located features casinos and nightclubs and is probably not somewhere those new to town should stroll around in. The executive lounge is OK, breakfast selection is decent and it is well run. The gym is large, well equipped and is above average. My room was clean and spacious with an interesting view of the Panama city skyline but otherwise unremarkable. If I were to entertain colleagues or professional contacts here, I think I would wish for a more original lobby experience -it feels like a faded 70's queen. The staff were friendly, courteous and efficient and my check in and out experiences were flawless.
reviews.title: pretty average chain experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms were Marriott quality. Good beds and furnishing. The problem was the location... the vicinity was not a desirable location with all the bars in front, especially for my sister who felt uncomfortable. Would have preferred the other marriott, a courtyard, by the shopping mall where my sister and I spent the day.
reviews.title: Great concierge

reviews.text: Great hotel. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious, beds comfortable and no noise at all. The staff is very helpful. The breakfast buffet is quite good, including an omelette and waffle station.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The best of this hotel is its location. Great restaurants around the corner (try Peperoncini di Mare and Tre Scalini, both walking distance), as well as phone and internet booths.
reviews.title: outstanding hotel
Good Stay Would Stay Again
reviews.text: The area is safe and if you are going for business you are just a few blocks from the 50th street were most banks and law firms have their offices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Panama City Marriott is superb.
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights at the Marriott Panama and everything was exceptional. The staff are bilingual, which makes it easy to practice your Spanish. Front desk personnel, concierge, bell station, restaurant, housekeeping - we received excellent service everywhere. The hotel has a good location, within easy walking distance to restaurants and stores. Would absolutely stay there again.
reviews.title: Quality everywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was very good. I arrived from the airport at 7:00 am and I have asked for an early check-in. It was great to get into the room early in the morning after a 7 hours trip. The reservation using their website was also very easy and efficient.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: I came to this hotel on a business trip in November 2011. It was a very good experience. Clean, comfortable room, great staff, clean common areas, local beers only $3 at the sports bar... . I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great business hotel, very pleaseant staff

reviews.text: My room on a high floor was spotless, with a great bed and a nice city view. All the staff I encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfasts were great. Not the continental junk. This was a nice high quality buffet, they even had the egg and omelet guy.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: The Panama Marriott Hotel nicely appointed, rooms are what you expect from a first class hotel, service excellent; we were there while their pool area is being rennovated and the rates are great for this quality hotel...Superb value; excellent restaurants within easy walk or an inexpensive cab ride. Executive lounge for frequent travellers is excellent, and OPEN 7 days a week, unlike many Marriott hotels in the states where they shut down the lounge for the weekend. Staff is friendly and excellent.
reviews.title: Comfortable, spacious room

reviews.text: The rooms were a generous size and with everything you would expect in a Marriot hotel. Storage, a decent bathroom, and a sitting area, good but not more or less than I would expect.
reviews.title: Had hoped for better, and it could be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel amenities were however an issue, uneven availability of food and drink. The sports bar was not good, the lobby bar was open one night but not others, and the restaurant was a mystery as to when it was open. The pool was closed for rehab while I was there but was not particularly inviting at any rate.
reviews.title: Standard chain hotel, pity their main restaurant closes at meal times.

reviews.text: I was traveling by myself but the hotel is well located for some good restaurants. But it is iffy to walk, the side walks are pockmarked and construction is ongoing, and I am not sure I would have walked far by myself. Service at the concierge desk andelsewhere is a little lacksadaisical, if you do not ask the right question, you dont get an answer that is helpful.
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms, decent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was acceptable but for the imposing nature of the lobby, it felt somewhat empty and uninviting since the restaurants and bar areas were empty.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.text: We chose this as the least bad option when having one night in Panama City, but we expected better than this. There was nothing wrong with the room, but the hotel facilities were a bit lacking. Internet was charged at $12.95 per day, which is now pretty extortionate. The main problem was then when we wanted dinner, the hotel's cafe/restaurant turned out to be closed; it had looked open earlier on, presumably they only close at meal-times. They re-directed us to the sports bar, a truly unpleasant area, with a very limited menu, which we quickly rejected. We found another couple who had also rejected the sports bar.
reviews.title: Panama City Marriott Downtown
